name: IntersectionITI_Appointment_Status_Reason_CodesAndITI_Appointment_Status_Reason_Codes
title: Intersection of ITI Appointment Status Reason Codes And ITI Appointment Status Reason Codes

concept.display: Laboratory Test Results Out of Acceptable Range
concept.definition: An appointment for an patient was cancelled by the provider because the patient's laboratory test results were outside  of acceptable limits.

concept.display: CMS Therapy Cap Service Not Authorized
concept.definition: An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the provider because the service not authorized by CMS.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the provider because the patient died.
An appointment for an inpatient was cancelled by the provider because the patient was discharged from the facility.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the patient because the patient was unhappy with service or care.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the provider because needed equipment was not available (e.g., in use, out for repairs).
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the provider because of some unspecified financial reason ( e.g., no authorization.
An appointment for an outpatient was cancelled by the provider because the patient was hospitalized.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the provider because the intravenous access was not satisfactory for the procedure.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the patient because the patients signs and or symptoms improved and the patient no longer wanted care.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the provider because a  needed interpreter was not available.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the patient because the patient moved out of the area.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the patient because the patient did not have the prequisite diagnostic tests performed.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the patient because the patient changed provider.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the patient because the patient did not arrive for the appointment
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the provider because of some other reason not listed in this code list.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the patient
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the provider for personal reasons
An appointment for an patient was cancelled by the provider because the patient's treatment plan changed
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the patient because the patient was pregnant.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the provider because needed preparatory insructions and/or medications not completed.

concept.display: Preparatory Requirements or Medication or Test Results Unavailable
concept.definition: An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the provider because a needed diagnostic test or medications were not available.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the patient because the patient decided they did not want the  service or procedure.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the provider because the room or location was not available (e.g., in use, undergoing maintenance).
An appointment for a patient was cancelled because it was made in error by the provider
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the provider
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the patient because the patient's insurance membership was terminated.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the patient because the patients was not able to transport herself to the visit location.
An appointment for a patient was cancelled by the provider or patient because of inclement weather.
